description: Kachori pastry is stuffed with spicy peas and deep fried for an indulgent Indian street food treat.
keywords: Savoury pastry,Pescatarian,Halal,Seafood free,Vegetarian,Egg free,Vegan,Lemon,Sesame free,Dairy free
name: Spicy Pea Kachori Recipe | Woolworths
recipeIngredient: 1L vegetable oil, divided, 5 tbs, save the rest for deep frying
240g plain flour, save some for dusting

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a tablespoon of the oil in a large pan on medium high heat and cook the onions for 5 minutes. Add the garlic and ginger paste and chilli and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in the cumin, ground coriander, garam masala and lemon juice and cook for 1 minute. Stir in the peas and cook for 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and roughly mash with a fork. Stir in the fresh coriander and set aside.

Add the flour to a large bowl and add the rest of the oil and 140ml of water. Mix until you have a smooth dough. Rest, covered for 15 minutes. Divide the dough into 15 pieces and flatten into discs. Place a spoonful of pea filling in the middle of each and seal the edges around it. Roll into balls, flatten into discs and set aside.

Heat oil in a large, deep pan. Drop the dough into the oil carefully, working in batches. Deep fry for 12 minutes on each side until crisp, golden and puffed up. Drain on kitchen paper and serve with mango chutney.
